Title: A direct projection from hippocampal field CA1 to ventral area TE of inferotemporal cortex in the monkey.
Abstract: Retrogradely labeled cells were found in field CA1 of the hippocampal formation in monkeys following injections of horseradish peroxidase in ventral area TE of inferotemporal cortex. No hippocampal label was found following injections in dorsal area TE and area TEO. The findings provide the first demonstration of a direct projection from hippocampal field CA1 to area TE.

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Citation:
"The delineations of cortical areas TE and TEO in IT cortex and their bordering areas TA, TF, TG, TH, V4 and 35 (perirhinal ) were based on the cytoarchitectonic parcellations of von Bonin and Bailey [22] and Brodmann [2] as well as functional findings in our laboratory [9-12] (Fig. 1A). IT  cortex consists, rostrally, of area TE and, caudally, area TEO [22]. Also, IT cortex consists, dorsally, of middle temporal gyrus and, ventrally, inferior temporal gyrus, which correspond to Brodmann' s areas 21 and 20 (ref. 2), respectively.
Since the distributions and densities of amygdalar connections with the middle and inferior temporal gyri differ [11, 12], areas TE and TEO were divided into dorsal and ventral subdivisions [12], viz. fields TEd and TEv in area TE, and fields TEOd and TEOv in area TEO. The boirder between dorsal and ventral fields was established  as the anterior middle temporal sulcus and its caual extension toward the gaze point in area V1 (Fig. 1A).
The hippocampal formation was divided into 7 fields according to the descriptions of Lorente de Nó [13] and Van Hoesen and Pandya [21]; the dentate gyrus, CA1, CA2, CA3 and CA4 fields of the hippocampus proper, the prosubiculum and subiculum (Fig. 1C). Field CA2 was defined as that region, in which large CA3 pyramidal cells overlap small CA1 pyramidal cells [17]. The multilayered presubiculum and parasubiculum were classified as parts of parahippocampal cortex [20, 21]." (pp. 397, 399)

The multilayered presubiculum and parasubiculum were classified as parts of parahippocampal cortex [20, 21]." (pp. 397, 399)

The hippocampal formation was divided into 7 fields according to the descriptions of Lorente de Nó [13] and Van Hoesen and Pandya [21]; the dentate gyrus, CA1, CA2, CA3 and CA4 fields of the hippocampus proper, the prosubiculum and subiculum (Fig. 1C). Field CA2 was defined as that region, in which large CA3 pyramidal cells overlap small CA1 pyramidal cells [17]. The multilayered presubiculum and parasubiculum were classified as parts of parahippocampal cortex [20, 21]." (pp. 397, 399)

publication.title: A direct projection from hippocampal field CA1 to ventral area TE of inferotemporal cortex in the monkey.
publication.abstract: Retrogradely labeled cells were found in field CA1 of the hippocampal formation in monkeys following injections of horseradish peroxidase in ventral area TE of inferotemporal cortex. No hippocampal label was found following injections in dorsal area TE and area TEO. The findings provide the first demonstration of a direct projection from hippocampal field CA1 to area TE.
